plugins.name: Paste Data

🧩 Paste CSV into Text Layers

Paste tabular data directly into selected Figma text layers. Supports Excel or CSV data, auto-detects rows or columns, and applies values instantly.

⚡ Designed for quick content updates and data-driven designs

plugins.name: Select Matching Layers in Frame
plugins.description:
Instantly find repeated frames or component instances within the same frame and edit them all at once.


Figma’s built-in “Select Matching Layers” feature only works across different frames. This plugin is similar but works within a single frame. Quickly select repeating elements within a single frame and adjust their properties, just like the multi-edit feature. For convenience I recommend setting up a custom shortcut for the plugin.


Pair with Master plugin

Turn matching layers into a single component in seconds with the Master plugin:

1. Use Select Matching Layers in Frame to find all repeated elements

2. Run Master → Create Component from Objects

3. Done. You’ll get a single, clean component with overrides preserved


Technical details:

  1. Select all instances of a component (including variants) when selecting an instance
  2. Select all layers with matching name and type when selecting any other layer
  3. Searches within the same frame only
  4. Select multiple objects within different frames, plugin will find all the matches


If you have any questions or feedback, please comment below!
plugins.tagline: Instantly find, select and edit similar layers within a single frame

plugins.name: ProdMax
plugins.description:
Prodmax - 10X Your Ideas into Software Execllence


ProdMax is an innovative intelligent frontend development platform that seamlessly integrates with both Web interfaces and Figma plugins to transform design mockups into high-quality frontend code. The platform aims to significantly enhance development efficiency, foster team collaboration, and streamline the design-to-development workflow.


Use Case:


Step 1. User Authentication

  1. Users complete secure authentication through the account-password login system to access the platform workspace

Step 2. Intelligent Component Creation

  1. Select target layers in the Figma interface
  2. Click the "New Biz Component" button to initiate component creation
  3. Add professional naming and functional descriptions for the component
  4. View corresponding DSL node structures in the component details page
  5. Support editing or deleting created components as needed

Step 3. Intelligent Page Construction

  1. Select page-level layers in Figma
  2. Click the "New Page" button to initiate page creation
  3. Add semantic naming and functional descriptions for the page
  4. View complete DSL node structures in the page details interface
  5. Support editing or deleting created pages as needed
plugins.tagline: 10X Your Ideas into Software Execllence

127368.description:

ProdMax is an innovative intelligent frontend development platform that seamlessly integrates with both Web interfaces and Figma plugins to transform design mockups into high-quality frontend code. The platform aims to significantly enhance development efficiency, foster team collaboration, and streamline the design-to-development workflow.


Use Case:

Step 2. Intelligent Component Creation

plugins.name: Spacing and radius fixer
plugins.description:
Auto-fix spacing & radius

Plugin that automatically rounds spacing and radius values to the nearest preset value in Auto Layout objects.


What it does

- Rounds gap and padding values to the nearest preset spacing

- Rounds corner radius to the nearest preset radius

- Works with any Auto Layout object (frames, components, instances)


Presets

Default values (can be customized in plugin):

Spacing: 0, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 16, 20, 24, 32, 40, 48, 56, 64, 80 (px)

Radius: 0, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 16, 20, 100 (px)


How to use

1. Select Auto Layout object(s)

2. Run the plugin

3. Switch between Spacing/Radius modes

4. Customize presets if needed (or use Reset to restore defaults)

5. Click Apply
plugins.tagline: Fixes inconsistent spacing and radius values by rounding them to the nearest preset

plugins.name: Import AppStore Screenshots
plugins.description:
Screens.farm


How to import iOS screenshots into Figma

  1. In figma, open the plugin menu and launch "Appstore Screenshots"
  2. Enter the iOS app name or url
  3. Click Import


✅ Screenshots are added to your canvas, perfectly aligned and ready to use.


---


Why use screens.farm?

  1. Save hours by skipping the download → upload → organize loop
  2. Instantly grab all App Store screenshots in one click
  3. Create moodboards, presentations, or competitor benchmarks effortlessly
  4. Speed up your app store page redesign workflow
  5. Collaborate with teams on real product screenshots, directly in Figma


---


🎁 FREE version includes limited app imports


---


🚀 License


Unlock the full power of **screens.farm** with a PRO license:


  1. Unlimited app imports
  2. Faster imports with priority processing
  3. Import iPhone & iPad screenshots
  4. Premium support


---


Stop wasting time downloading screenshots one by one.

Let screens.farm do the heavy lifting — so you can focus on design.
plugins.tagline: Import ios apps in one click

plugins.name: Feedback Factory - Generate Feedback Screens from Spreadsheet Data
plugins.description:
The Feedback Factory is a plugin designed to streamline the creation of feedback screen variants from spreadsheet data.


Here's how to use it:


1. Upload Excel File 📂: Start by uploading an spreadsheet file containing feedback types and their respective content. The plugin will process this data to generate feedback variants.


2. Create Variants 🎨: Add up to 10 variants by selecting a feedback type for each one. The plugin allows you to customize titles, descriptions, and button texts for each variant.


3. Generate Components 🚀: Once your variants are set, click "Create Variants" to automatically generate the feedback components in Figma. The plugin will clone the selected frame or component and update the text elements based on the spreadsheet data.


This tool is perfect for designers looking to efficiently manage and create multiple feedback screens with consistent styling and content.
plugins.tagline: Generate feedback screens in Figma from spreadsheet data with ease and efficiency.

120235.name: Feedback Factory - Generate Feedback Screens from Spreadsheet Data
120235.description:
The Feedback Factory is a plugin designed to streamline the creation of feedback screen variants from spreadsheet data.


Here's how to use it:


1. Upload Excel File 📂: Start by uploading an spreadsheet file containing feedback types and their respective content. The plugin will process this data to generate feedback variants.


2. Create Variants 🎨: Add up to 10 variants by selecting a feedback type for each one. The plugin allows you to customize titles, descriptions, and button texts for each variant.


3. Generate Components 🚀: Once your variants are set, click "Create Variants" to automatically generate the feedback components in Figma. The plugin will clone the selected frame or component and update the text elements based on the spreadsheet data.


This tool is perfect for designers looking to efficiently manage and create multiple feedback screens with consistent styling and content.

networkAccess.reasoning: Required to load feedback data from online spreadsheet

120235.release_notes: Added use of csv in addition to Excel
120235.tagline: Generate feedback screens in Figma from spreadsheet data with ease and efficiency.

plugins.name: Case Shifter
plugins.description:
Overview

Streamline your design workflow with the Frame Renamer plugin for Figma! This tool allows you to quickly and efficiently rename frame names, making it especially useful when organizing and exporting layers.


Features

  1. Quick Rename: Easily rename frames in bulk, saving time and effort.
  2. Organize Layers: Keep your Figma projects neat and well-organized by using consistent naming conventions.
  3. Efficient Exporting: Simplify your exporting process by standardizing layer names, reducing errors and improving efficiency.


Supported Naming Conventions

The Frame Renamer currently supports the following cases:

  1. camelCase: e.g., frameNameExample
  2. snake_case: e.g., frame_name_example
  3. kebab-case: e.g., frame-name-example
  4. PascalCase: e.g., FrameNameExample


Future Updates

We are continually working to improve the Frame Renamer plugin. Stay tuned for more features and naming conventions in future updates!
plugins.tagline: Transform your Layer name, one case at a time.

101569.name: Case Shifter
101569.description:

plugins.name: Sliding Text
plugins.description:
Sliding Text transforms static text into engaging animated components with just a few clicks. This plugin allows designers to:


  1. Convert any text layer into a dynamic text slide component
  2. Customize animation direction (top-to-bottom, bottom-to-top, left-to-right, right-to-left)
  3. Fine-tune animation timing, stagger delay, and easing
  4. Preview animations directly in the plugin interface
  5. Create components that maintain the original text's font, size, and styling
  6. Generate a "done" state for the final animation frame


Simply select a text layer, enter your phrases or words separated by commas, choose your animation settings, and let the plugin generate a fully configured component with smart animate transitions. Perfect for creating engaging sliding text / rotating messages / dynamic text effects without any coding knowledge.
plugins.tagline: Smooth text slide animations with customizable directions and timing

129512.description:

  4. Preview animations directly in the plugin interface
  5. Create components that maintain the original text's font, size, and styling

plugins.name: Move to Origin
plugins.description:
Move to Origin is a simple utility plugin that positions your selected elements so that the topmost and leftmost element sits precisely at coordinates (0,0).


Instructions

1. Select one or more elements on your Figma canvas

2. Run the "Move to Origin" plugin from the Plugins menu

3. Your selection will instantly move so the topmost-leftmost element is at (0,0)


Key features:

  1. One-click positioning to origin point (0,0)
  2. Maintains relative spacing between all selected elements
  3. Works with any number of selected objects
  4. No UI — just select and run


Perfect for:

  1. Cleaning up artboard layouts
  2. Preparing elements for export
  3. Standardizing component positions
  4. Aligning multiple elements to a predictable starting point


Simply select the elements you want to reposition, run the plugin, and watch as your selection snaps to the origin while preserving the spatial relationships between all elements.


Save time and maintain precision in your designs with this essential positioning tool.
plugins.tagline: Instantly align your selection to (0,0) while preserving relative positions between elements.

plugins.name: xps.to.design — by ‹div›RIOTS — Import XPS documents (.xps and .oxps)
plugins.description:
Import any XPS document as fully editable Figma designs.


Convert any XPS document into Figma designs. Import your XPS into Figma as designs with fully editable text layers, or as static, pixel-perfect images.


How to import XPS documents into Figma:

  1. Run this Figma plugin, xps.to.design
  2. Upload your file, or drag-and-drop it into the plugin
  3. Click “Import”
  4. Your document will be imported into Figma as fully-editable layers or high-res images!


Why use xps.to.design?

  1. Extract images and text from your XPSs and get them straight into Figma.
  2. Collaborate on XPS documents with your team in Figma.
  3. Use XPS as templates for new designs in Figma.
  4. And much more!


FREE

  1. 5 imports
  2. Imports as editable layers: First 3 pages only


PRO License

  1. Full features, multiple files at once and unlimited imports
  2. $49 for 1-year (not recurring)

or

  1. $99 for 3-years (not recurring)

accepted.name: divRIOTS
accepted.description: Making better tools so designers and developers can focus on what matters and work collaboratively as a team.

plugins.tagline: Import any XPS document as fully editable Figma designs

plugins.name: FigCrawl
plugins.description:
FigCrawl: Your FigJam Content Extractor


What is FigCrawl?

FigCrawl is a powerful FigJam plugin that transforms your collaborative boards into structured, AI-ready data. It intelligently extracts and organizes all your board's content while preserving the visual hierarchy and relationships between elements.


Use Cases

For Designers & Teams

  1. Extract structured content from brainstorming sessions
  2. Convert visual collaboration into actionable data
  3. Document and archive board content
  4. Share board content in a structured format


For AI/LLM Integration

  1. Feed board content into AI tools
  2. Generate summaries and reports
  3. Analyze relationships between ideas
  4. Create structured documentation


For Documentation

  1. Export board content for documentation
  2. Create structured reports
  3. Archive important board sessions
  4. Share insights with stakeholders



How It Works

  1. Launch: Open the plugin in your FigJam board
  2. Extract: Click "Extract Content" to scan your board
  3. Review: See a summary of extracted content
  4. Copy: Choose to copy the entire board or individual pages
  5. Use: Paste the JSON into your preferred AI tool or LLM
plugins.tagline: Extract FigJam content into AI-ready data with one click

FigCrawl is a powerful FigJam plugin that transforms your collaborative boards into structured, AI-ready data. It intelligently extracts and organizes all your board's content while preserving the visual hierarchy and relationships between elements.

plugins.name: i18n JSON exporter
plugins.description:
Escape the time-consuming manual localization work and costly third-party tools with their cumbersome plugins. Leverage the power of Figma variables for efficient i18n.


Simply use your Design System or a central library file to create i18n keys, and then effortlessly export them for development with this plugin.


Step 1

Setup your Figma variables. Create a collection, add a columns (modes) for each language you wish to localize.


Not a step

Use those variables to replace your labels, input placeholders and more. Then use the "Appearance > Apply variable mode" to switch between languages (modes). I suggest having an "ID" mode with the i18n keys, like $general.table.label_lastModified.


Step 2

Run this plugin, select a collection and modes desired, then click "Export JSON file".


Note

This plugin uses the variable group path to create a hierarchical structure in the exported JSON. For example, a variable named general / table / label_lastModified would be exported as:


{
"general": {
"table": {
"label_lastModified": "Last modified"
}
}
}


Future features

Leave comments to vote on the following features I planned and what features you would like to see on this plugin.

  1. Github Merge Request integration
  2. Support to different JSON formats
  3. Transformation capabilities
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly export your Figma i18n variables to a React-compatible JSON format

Step 1

Use those variables to replace your labels, input placeholders and more. Then use the "Appearance > Apply variable mode" to switch between languages (modes). I suggest having an "ID" mode with the i18n keys, like $general.table.label_lastModified.


Step 2

Note

This plugin uses the variable group path to create a hierarchical structure in the exported JSON. For example, a variable named general / table / label_lastModified would be exported as:

122826.tagline: Effortlessly export your Figma i18n variables to a React-compatible JSON format

plugins.name: Text Styles from CSV
plugins.description:
**Text Styles from CSV** is a Figma plugin that allows users to import text styles directly from a CSV file, saving time and ensuring consistency across projects.


### ✨ Features:

- 📂 Import text styles from a CSV file with one click.

- 🔠 Supports font family, weight, size, letter spacing, and line height.

- 🎨 Automatically creates text styles in Figma for easy reuse.

- ⚡ Speeds up the design process by reducing manual styling.


### 📌 How It Works:

1. Open the plugin in Figma.

2. Upload your CSV file containing text style definitions.

3. Click "Import" to instantly create and apply styles.


For more details, check the **[GitHub Repository](https://github.com/metagrati/text-styles-from-csv).**
plugins.tagline: Import text styles into Figma from a CSV file. Automate typography styles creation.

120678.name: Text Styles from CSV
120678.description:

plugins.name: Protoboi
plugins.description:
From the makers of 'Prototype This!'... comes Protoboi.


Protoboi is a tool to save you time prototyping. It helps you perfect your interactions (bezier easing curves, durations etc.) quickly by treating them in a componentized way.


Here's how the workflow works-


1) Use our other plugin 'Prototype This!' to wire up your prototype fast.

2) Make an interaction in Figma, and get all the animation properties just how you want it.

3) Open Protoboi & bulk-apply these animation parts, like custom bezier easing curves.


It's in beta, but mostly works. Feedback appreciated (comments or drop messages on livechat). :-)
plugins.tagline: Make prototypes fast w/ Protoboi! Bulk-apply animation properties to your interactions in seconds.

plugins.description: Constantly reveal spacing between elements in your designs with clear, red labels showing exact pixel measurements. plugins.name: ARBFromDesign
plugins.description: Streamline your localization workflow with the ARBFromDesign plugin for Figma. This tool automatically extracts text from your Figma frames and generates ARB (Application Resource Bundle) entries in camelCase format, ready for translation. The plugin intelligently excludes date and time formats, ensuring clean and accurate entries. With a simple click, you can export your design text to ARB files, speeding up your localization process and making your designs truly global.

plugins.name: Shopdev: Figma to Shopify Liquid
plugins.description:
Figma to Shopify Liquid

Turn any Figma design into responsive Liquid code that’s ready to publish to your Shopify theme with the Shopdev Figma plugin. Select your frame in Figma, import it into Shopdev, and deploy in a few clicks, no coding required.


How it works

  1. Open the plugin: Launch the plugin directly within your Figma design file.
  2. Select the frame: Choose any frame, like a hero, banner, testimonial, or promo section.
  3. Click “Import frame”: The plugin automatically transfers your selected design to shopdev.ai.
  4. Customize prompt (Optional): You’ll see a pre-filled prompt “Build this Figma import”; you have the option to add extra input if desired (e.g., "Use a slider for the images on mobile").
  5. Submit the prompt: Shopdev will generate responsive Liquid code you can preview.
  6. Edit and iterate: Continue prompting shopdev to refine your design until it’s perfect.
  7. Publish: Click to deploy directly to your Shopify theme.


Support

For additional support using this plugin, ask questions in the Shopdev Discord channel.


Tips for best results: Use Auto Layout

Auto Layout isn’t required, but it helps the AI better understand your design’s structure and spacing. Using it can lead to more accurate imports with less additional prompting needed, especially for responsive layouts.


From Figma to Shopify with the help of Shopdev, an AI Shopify developer

With the Shopdev Figma plugin, you can convert any static Figma design into live, editable Shopify theme sections, ideal for:

  1. Homepage sections like banners, product features, testimonials, or value props
  2. Landing page sections that can be reused across multiple campaigns
  3. PDP add-ons like trust badges, comparison charts, or upsell modules
  4. Reusable content blocks that can be dragged and dropped across templates
  5. Custom sections for any part of your store without needing a developer


Shopdev automatically interprets your Figma design and generates responsive Liquid code that works natively within Shopify’s theme system. You can edit the output manually or continue refining it through prompts.
plugins.tagline: Use AI to turn any Figma design into Shopify-ready Liquid code

136273.name: Shopdev: Figma to Shopify Liquid

  5. Submit the prompt: Shopdev will generate responsive Liquid code you can preview.

From Figma to Shopify with the help of Shopdev, an AI Shopify developer

Shopdev automatically interprets your Figma design and generates responsive Liquid code that works natively within Shopify’s theme system. You can edit the output manually or continue refining it through prompts.

136273.tagline: Use AI to turn any Figma design into Shopify-ready Liquid code

127735.description:
Scenario Stamp helps product designers create clean, consistent headers for their prototype flows. Add project names, scenario titles, and essential metadata—so developers and stakeholders instantly understand what they're looking at.


No more guessing games or messy handoffs. Just drop in a stamp, label your work, and keep your Figma files organized and handoff-ready.


✅ Perfect for:


Organizing prototype flows


Prepping for developer handoff


Communicating design intent


Making your files easier to navigate


Make your designs speak for themselves—with Scenario Stamp.
